intro: Galium bourgaeanum var. maroccanum, commonly known as the Moroccan bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white or pale pink flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a valuable component of local ecosystems and a subject of interest in botanical studies.
